result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andre Lee Wilson Jr

defendant.name: Wilson, Andre Lee, Jr
defendant.address: 5901 West Brown Deer Road Apt 208, Milwaukee, WI 53223

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andre Lee Wilson Jr in court.  Attorney Maryann Corea in court for Andre Lee Wilson Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for pretrial conference.
Defense counsel has not received discovery and has received offer and requests additional time. Court grants request.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 13.
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Andre Lee Wilson Jr
Current: 5901 West Brown Deer Road Apt 208, Milwaukee, WI 53223   (Effective: 09-15-2022)
Prior: 5901 West Brown Deer Road, Milwaukee, WI 53223
ORAL No Contact with DJB, and EMJ

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 10/05/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST. 
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No driving without a valid license. 
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Andre Lee Wilson Jr in court.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Reserve, Branch 13. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 13 for a Pretrial Conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 10/3/22 @ 1:30p
